G4740-d-03-09-00-WC.Narrative: SWITCH JOB, SYO251, WAS SWITCHING CARS AT THE CHAMPION PAPER MILL IN QUINNESEC.  THE CREW HAD SET 2EMPTIES AND 1 LOAD ON TRACK 8 WITH ONLY ONE HAND BRAKE ON THE LEAD CAR.  THEY THEN STARTED IN ON TRACK 9 TO SPOT 4 LOADS.  THEY HAD STOPPED THEIR MOVMENT AS THE 3 CARS ON TRACK 8 ROLLED OUT AND INTO THE SIDE OF THE TRAIN ON TRACK 9.  NO CARS WERE DERAILED AND THERE WAS NO TRACK DAMAGE IN THE INCIDENT.  HOWEVER, GATX 22051 AND SSPX 1237 WERE DAMAGED IN THE IMPACT.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT NOT ENOUGH HAND BRAKES HAD BEEN SET ON THE CARS LEFT ON TRACK 8 TO HOLD THEM IN PLACE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

157529-d-03-20-00-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
157529-d-03-20-00-SOO.Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
157529-d-03-20-00-SOO.Narrative: DURING AUTOMATIC HUMPING OPERATION, AS LAST CARS OF DRAG WERE HUMPED, IMPACT OF TWO CARS OCCURRED RESULTING IN THE DERAILMENT OF ONE OF THE TWO CARS IMPACTED.  AT 0230 ON 3/20/00, TWO CARS WERE HUMPEDTO 36 TRACK.   ONE CAR HAD A PARTIAL HANDBRAKE AND THE CARS STALLED ON 36 TRACK FOULING 34 TRACK.THE LAST CUT OF 2 CARS ON THE HUMP LIST WERE ALSO FOR 36 TRACK.  AS THESE 2 CARS PASSED THE 5TH GROUP RETARDER, THE PROYARD SYSTEM TRANSFERRED OVER TO TRIM MODE.  TRIM MODE WAS PRE-CONDITIONED FOR 34TRACK TO SWITCH OVER 60 SECONDS AFTER LAST CAR PASSED OVER HUMP CREST.  AT THE END OF 60 SECONDS, ROUTE WAS LINED FOR 34 TRACK CAUSING CORNERING OF CAR ON 36 TRACK.  ROOT CAUSE OF INCIDENT:  PROYARD AUTOMATICALLY CYCLED OUT OF AUTOMATIC MODE TO TRIM MODE PRIOR TO COMPLETION OF HUMPING OPERATIONS BYPROGRAM DESIGN.  RECOMMENDED CORRECTIVE ACTION # 1:    ELIMINATE AUTOMATIC SWING FROM AUTOMATIC HUMPMODE TO TRIM MODE UPON COMPLETION OF HUMP LIST.  PROGRAM CHANGED TO REQUIRE MANUAL CHANGE FROM AUTOMATIC MODE TO TRIM AND TRIM TO AUTOMATIC.   RECOMMENDED CORRECTIVE ACTION # 2:   CHANGE IN PROGRAM COMMUNICATED TO HUMP YARDMASTERS.  CONTRIBUTING FACTOR #1:  CAR STALLED ON LEAD AT ENTRANCE TO C36 TRACK BECAUSE OF PARTIAL HANDBRAKE.  RECOMMENDED CORRECTIVE ACTION:  HUMP SWITCH CREW TO ASSURE HANBRAKES ARE FULLY RELEASED PRIOR TO RELEASING CARS.None

MNN032300-d-03-23-00-MNN.Primary Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing crossties)
MNN032300-d-03-23-00-MNN.Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing crossties)
MNN032300-d-03-23-00-MNN.Narrative: TEN LOADED CARS DERAILED WHILE A MINNESOTA NORTHERN RAILROAD (MNN) GRAIN TRAIN, TRAVELING WEST ON THE BURLINGTON NORTHER SANTA FE (BNSF) TRACK WAS ATTEMPTING TO YARD THEIR TRAIN AT THE EAST YARD LEADIN CROOKSTON, MN.  EIGHT OF THE TEN DERAILED GRAIN CARS TIPPED OVER ONTO THEIR SIDES, SPILLING A PORTION OF THEIR CONTENTS AND FOULING THE BNSF MAIN LINE.  THE BNSF MAINLINE WAS OUT OF SERVICE FOR APPROXIMATELY 16 HOURS, UNTIL WORKERS COULD CLEAR THE WRECKAGE.  THE TWO LOCOMOTIVES EVENT RECORDER TAPES WERE EVALUATED BY MNN AND BNSF OFFICIALS AND IT WAS DETERMINED THAT TRAIN HANDLING WAS NOT A CONTRIBUTING FACTOR IN THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT.  CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT WAS DETERMINED TO BE WIDE GAGE, DUE TO DEFECTIVE CROSSTIES. CONTRIBUTING FACTORS INCLUDE SOFT ROADBED, DUE TO WARMING TEMPERATURE FORCING THE FROST TO LEAVE THE GROUND.  MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION IN THE FORM OF RAIN ALSO CONTRIBUTED TO THE SOFT ROADBED CONDITIONS.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
